explanation: The report is not correct. The agent's scenario assumes sizeof(int) == 1. The C standard (and practically all conforming implementations) require INT_MAX >= 32767 (see limits.h), which implies int is at least 16 bits on a conforming implementation. With CHAR_BIT >= 8 this means sizeof(int) >= 2, so sizeof(int) == 1 cannot occur for a conforming C implementation. Therefore the while condition is not inherently always false on any conforming target; the loop body can be reached (e.g. when dest or ptr are not aligned to sizeof(int)). MISRA Rule 2.1 forbids unreachable code in the project, but this code is not provably unreachable under the constraints of a conforming C implementation, so the reported violation is incorrect.
